page.title: 05CUMBERNAULD - THE TOWN
page.content: The name{Cumbernauld}is derived from the Gaelic{"Cumar-nan-alt"}which means {"The meeting of the waters".}This reflects the town's position on the watershed between the rivers Forth and Clyde.Cumbernauld was designated as a New Town in 1956.Since it's beginning the town has seen steady and continual development in population, industry, trade and leisure. The population of Cumbernauld in 1984 is about 50,000- the target population for the end of the century is 70,000. Taking into account all kinds of business there are over 500 firms in Cumbernauld. Some of these companies come from countries overseas such as USA, Sweden, West Germany, Iceland and Japan. Land is still available for constructing factories, houses and leisure facilities.
